metadata.name: Add Insecure Download Source To Winget
metadata.comment: Detects usage of winget to add a new insecure (http) download source. Winget will not allow the addition of insecure sources, hence this could indicate potential suspicious activity (or typos)

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\winget.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('winget.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('source ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('add ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('http://')))

output.summary: Detects usage of winget to add a new insecure (http) download source. Winget will not allow the addition of insecure sources, hence this could indicate potential suspicious activity (or typos)

metadata.objective: False positive: False positives might occur if the users are unaware of such control checks References: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/package-manager/winget/source, https://github.com/nasbench/Misc-Research/tree/b9596e8109dcdb16ec353f316678927e507a5b8d/LOLBINs/Winget
